definition: Money owed by a business to its suppliers or vendors for goods or services purchased on credit
example: The company's accounts payable increased after ordering new office equipment on 30-day payment terms

definition: Return on Investment - a performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency or profitability of an investment
example: The marketing campaign generated an ROI of 300%, with $30,000 in profit from a $10,000 investment

definition: Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization - a measure of a company's overall financial performance
example: The startup's EBITDA grew from $1M to $5M in just two years, showing strong operational performance

definition: The percentage of total sales in an industry generated by a particular company
example: After launching their new product line, the company's market share increased from 15% to 25%

definition: Key Performance Indicator - a quantifiable measure used to evaluate the success of an organization, employee, or project in meeting objectives
example: Customer satisfaction scores are an important KPI for our support team

definition: Lifetime Value - the total revenue a customer generates for a business over their entire relationship
example: The LTV of a customer is $10,000, with an average purchase value of $50 and a purchase frequency of 2 times per year

definition: Customer Acquisition Cost - the total cost of acquiring a new customer
example: The CAC for our new marketing campaign was $100,000, with 100 new customers acquired

definition: Monthly Recurring Revenue - the total amount of recurring revenue a business earns from its customers each month
example: The MRR of our SaaS product is $10,000, with 100 customers paying $100 per month

definition: Annual Recurring Revenue - the total amount of recurring revenue a business earns from its customers each year
example: The ARR of our SaaS product is $100,000, with 100 customers paying $1,000 per year

definition: Lifetime Value - the total revenue a customer generates for a business over their entire relationship
example: The LTV of a customer is $10,000, with an average purchase value of $50 and a purchase frequency of 2 times per year
